metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6313 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
The mixing functions in the random number generator in Libgcrypt before 1.5.6, 1.6.x before 1.6.6, and 1.7.x before 1.7.3 and GnuPG before 1.4.21 make it easier for attackers to obtain the values of 160 bits by leveraging knowledge of the previous 4640 bits.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnupg - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.4
gnupg-curl - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.4
gpgv - 1.4.16-1ubuntu2.4
No subscription required

libgcrypt11 - 1.5.3-2ubuntu4.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> CVE number in announcement is wrong

criterions.comment: gnupg package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.16-1ubuntu2.4').
libgcrypt11 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.5.3-2ubuntu4.4').
libgcrypt20: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
